project.name: Clappr
project.description: An extensible media player for the web

components.name: components
components.description:
The Core is responsible to manage Containers, the mediator, MediaControl
and the player state.

Playback.name: Playback
Playback.description: An abstraction to represent a generic playback, it's like an interface to be implemented by subclasses.

UIObject.name: UIObject
UIObject.description: A base class to create ui object.

Container.name: Container
Container.description:
An abstraction to represent a container for a given playback
TODO: describe its responsabilities

Core.name: Core
Core.description:
The Core is responsible to manage Containers, the mediator, MediaControl
and the player state.

CoreFactory.name: CoreFactory
CoreFactory.description: The Core Factory is responsible for instantiate the core and it's plugins.

Loader.name: Loader
Loader.description: It keeps a list of the default plugins (playback, container, core) and it merges external plugins with its internals.

classitems.description:
it builds an ui component by:
 * creating an id for the component `cid`
 * making sure the element is created `$el`
 * delegating all `events` to the element

classitems.description: delegates all the original `events` on `element` to its callbacks

classitems.description: undelegats all the `events`

classitems.description: ensures the creation of this ui component
classitems.name: _ensureElement

classitems.description: Container is responsible for the video rendering and state
container's name
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: it builds a container
classitems.name: constructor

classitems.description:
binds playback events to the methods of the container.
it listens to playback's events and triggers them as container events.

| Playback |
|----------|
| progress |
| timeupdate |
| ready |
| buffering |
| bufferfull |
| settingsupdate |
| loadedmetadata |
| highdefinitionupdate |
| bitrate |
| playbackstate |
| dvr |
| mediacontrol_disable |
| mediacontrol_enable |
| ended |
| play |
| pause |
| error |

ps: the events usually translate from PLABACK_x to CONTAINER_x, you can check all the events at `Event` class.
classitems.name: bindEvents

classitems.description: returns `true` if DVR is enable otherwise `false`.

classitems.description: returns `true` if DVR is in use otherwise `false`.
classitems.name: isDvrInUse

params.name: playerId
params.description: you can embed multiple instances of clappr, therefore this is the unique id of each one.

params.description: the config object with all plugins

params.name: plugins
params.description: the config object with all plugins

classitems.description: The MediaControl is responsible for displaying the Player controls.
The mediator is a singleton for handling global events.

classitems.name: constructor

params.name: options
params.description:
Data
options to build a player instance

props.name: parentId
props.description: the id of the element on the page that the player should be inserted into

props.name: parent
props.description: a reference to a dom element that the player should be inserted into

props.name: mimeType
props.description: add `mimeType: "application/vnd.apple.mpegurl"` if you need to use a url without extension.

props.name: persistConfig
props.description: persist player's settings (volume) through the same domain **default**: `true`

props.name: preload
props.description: video will be preloaded according to `preload` attribute options **default**: `'metadata'`

props.name: maxBufferLength
props.description: the default behavior for the **HLS playback** is to keep buffering indefinitely, even on VoD. This replicates the behavior for progressive download, which continues buffering when pausing the video, thus making the video available for playback even on slow networks. To change this behavior use `maxBufferLength` where **value is in seconds**.

props.name: gaAccount
props.description: enable Google Analytics events dispatch **(play/pause/stop/buffering/etc)** by adding your `gaAccount`

props.name: gaTrackerName
props.description: besides `gaAccount` you can optionally, pass your favorite trackerName as `gaTrackerName`

props.name: mediacontrol
props.description: customize control bar colors, example: `mediacontrol: {seekbar: "#E113D3", buttons: "#66B2FF"}`

props.name: hideVolumeBar
props.description: when embedded with width less than 320, volume bar will hide. You can force this behavior for all sizes by adding `true` **default**: `false`

props.name: watermark
props.description: put `watermark: 'http://url/img.png'` on your embed parameters to automatically add watermark on your video. You can customize corner position by defining position parameter. Positions can be `bottom-left`, `bottom-right`, `top-left` and `top-right`.

props.name: disableVideoTagContextMenu
props.description: disables the context menu (right click) on the video element if a HTML5Video playback is used.

props.name: poster
props.description: define a poster by adding its address `poster: 'http://url/img.png'`. It will appear after video embed, disappear on play and go back when user stops the video.

classitems.description: Specify a `parentId` to the player.
classitems.name: setParentId

classitems.description: You can use this method to attach the player to a given element. You don't need to do this when you specify it during the player instantiation passing the `parentId` param.
classitems.name: attachTo

classitems.description: resizes the current player canvas.
classitems.name: resize

params.name: size
params.description: should be a literal object with `height` and `width`.

classitems.description: loads a new source.
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: destroys the current player and removes it from the DOM.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: plays the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: pauses the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: stops the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: seeks the current video (`source`). For example, `player.seek(50)` will seek to the middle of the current video.
classitems.name: seek

params.name: time
params.description: should be a number between 0 and 100.

classitems.description: Set the volume for the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: setVolume

params.name: volume
params.description: should be a number between 0 and 100, 0 being mute and 100 the max volume.

classitems.description: Get the volume for the current video
classitems.name: getVolume

return.description: volume should be a number between 0 and 100, 0 being mute and 100 the max volume.

classitems.description: mutes the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: mute

classitems.description: unmutes the current video (`source`).
classitems.name: unmute

classitems.description: checks if the player is playing.
classitems.name: isPlaying

return.description: `true` if the current source is playing, otherwise `false`

classitems.description: get a plugin by its name.
classitems.name: getPlugin

classitems.description: the current time in seconds.
classitems.name: getCurrentTime

return.description: current time (in seconds) of the current source

classitems.description: the duration time in seconds.
classitems.name: getDuration

return.description: duration time (in seconds) of the current source
